meanings.definition: A person or thing that diverts or redirects something
meanings.sent1: The diverter guided the water away from the flooded area.
meanings.sent2: The diverter moved the attention of the audience to a different topic.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel acted as a diverter, leading the dog on a chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a diverter, drawing attention from her tired eyes.
meanings.sent5: The magician used a diverter to make the coin disappear in a flash.

meanings.definition: A device used to divert or redirect the flow of a fluid
meanings.sent1: The diverter in the pipe directed the water towards the garden.
meanings.sent2: The diverter in the sprinkler system controlled the direction of the water spray.
meanings.sent3: The diverter in the fountain made the water dance in unexpected patterns.
meanings.sent4: The diverter in the shower head allowed for both rainfall and massage settings.
meanings.sent5: The diverter in the irrigation system ensured each plant received enough water.

meanings.definition: A switch or valve used to divert the flow of traffic
meanings.sent1: The traffic diverter directed cars away from the construction zone.
meanings.sent2: The diverter at the intersection changed the path of the vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The diverter at the crossroads caused a comical confusion among drivers.
meanings.sent4: The diverter on the highway rerouted cars to the detour.
meanings.sent5: The diverter near the school ensured a safe passage for pedestrians.
